intro: Hyperbaena paucinervis, commonly known as the slender hyperbaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with few veins, giving it the species name "paucinervis." It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
